concept.title: New multimedia components
concept.shortdesc: LwDITA adds new element types for multimedia content. These element types are compatible with HTML5; they are part of a forthcoming domain intended for use with DITA 1.3.

conbody.p: For years, authors have used different approaches to embed multimedia content in DITA-based deliverables for the Web. The DITA 1.3 specification recommends the object element type to include multimedia content in a topic, pointing out that it corresponds to the object element type in HTML. However, HTML5 introduced direct element types for audio and video. LwDITA updates the XML-to-HTML element type correspondence and introduces the following multimedia components, which are specialized from the DITA 1.3 object and param element types:

dlentry.dd: Audio is a link to sound to be included in the content.

dd.ph: Autoplay determines if audio or video content should automatically begin to play.

dlentry.dd: Controls enable user interfaces for video playback and volume in Web-aimed transformations.

dd.ph: Loop automatically returns to the start of audio or video content upon reaching its end.
Muted indicates if the audio of a media object will be silenced or not.

dlentry.dd: Poster is a link to an image or static video frame.
Source is a link to media resources of audio or video content.
Track is a link to time-based text data relevant to audio or video content.
Video is a link to an audiovisual product to be included in the content.

conbody.p: These multimedia components are not available in the MDITA core profile; they must be expressed in raw HDITA syntax as part of the MDITA extended profile.

p.ph: The DITA Technical Committee is working on a multimedia domain add-on for DITA 1.3 that would include some of these element types to maintain compatibility between DITA and LwDITA.
